name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 2-Amino-pyridine base, with a melting point around 100 degrees Celsius. The pyridine ring itself contributes to a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The naphthalene ring introduces additional pi-pi interactions and molecular weight, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces a dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl groups linked in a linear fashion raises the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and molecular weight. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and molecular weight.
